We have a huge problem with professional catering education. We can hardly find and recruit home grown talents.
Exactly! The language you use is quite telling. Not that many. Very few in fact. https://t.co/TwHF0usQRK

@Caterertweets @StickyWalnut @RestaurantMagUK The facts remain. 290 catering colleges in the UK. Where are the home grown talents?
This is a very big problem for the hospitality industry and one which is ignored or brushed under the carpet. What are we doing about it?
So to recap... 290 catering colleges in the UK. Yet we can very hardly employ home grown talents.
@StickyWalnut @Caterertweets @RestaurantMagUK Like you, I do get involved a lot. It is not enough however. System is wrong.
@StickyWalnut @Caterertweets @RestaurantMagUK I'm seeing no change. As bad as it ever was.
NONE. Exactly! @StickyWalnut @Caterertweets @RestaurantMagUK totally out of touch + set to be like this for years to come if nothing changes
How many home grown talents from catering college do you work with? @StickyWalnut @Caterertweets @RestaurantMagUK
@Caterertweets @RestaurantMagUK of college. This is not the case.
@Caterertweets @RestaurantMagUK If it was done correctly the industry would be able to employ home grown professional talents straight out
Professional catering education needs to be urgently reviewed and changed for the better in the UK @Caterertweets @RestaurantMagUK
